title: Understanding the Florida Everglades Ecosystem
objective: To understand the ecosystem of the Everglades, its importance, and its daily impact on us

sections.title: Warm Up
sections.description: An interactive session to gather prior knowledge and engage the students.
sections.instructions: Ask the students if they have heard about the Everglades before and to share what they know. Write their responses on the board. This will give you an idea about their prior knowledge and also spark curiosity about the topic.

sections.title: Direct Instruction
sections.description: Teacher-led instruction to introduce the topic and key concepts
sections.instructions: Use a world map to show the location of the Everglades in Florida. Explain what an ecosystem is, and introduce the Everglades as a unique ecosystem. Use a slide show or video to visually represent the Everglades, discussing the variety of life found there, its unique water flow, and its value to both local environments and globally.

sections.title: Guided Practice
sections.description: An interactive activity to reinforce understanding and allow for teacher guidance
sections.instructions: Distribute worksheets that include various activities such as matching animals to their descriptions, fill in the blanks about the importance of the Everglades, and a short answer question about how the Everglades can impact daily life. Work through the first few questions as a class, then allow the students to complete the rest on their own.

sections.title: Individual Practice
sections.description: Independent work to allow students to apply and practice their understanding
sections.instructions: Ask the students to write a short paragraph on why it's important to protect the Everglades. They should use the information they've learned from the lesson and the worksheet. Allow students to share their paragraphs if time allows.

assessment: Collect and review the worksheets and paragraphs to evaluate students' understanding of the Everglades ecosystem, its importance, and its daily impact. Take note of any misconceptions or errors to address in future lessons.
conclusion: Close the lesson by summarizing the importance of the Everglades, and encourage students to continue exploring ecosystems and their importance. Remind them of the impact these systems have on our daily lives.
